intro: Campylospermum gabonense subsp. gabonense, commonly known as the Gabon sandverbena, is a shrub native to Central Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or dune environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
